page.title: 12Local Farms
page.content: There ae about 35 farms or small holdings in the block. most are inalnd with tracks or self maintained roads leading to them. Milk is collected from the farms on a daily basis by milk tankers. Majority of holdings have telephone and electricity. The poles are placed at several points along the fields. Farm land is divided into small fields with high hedges, a haven for small birds and insects. With 4 or 5 well heeled farmers the farmyards are completely concreted and very clean. A small number are extremely well run with all modern machinery. There are no breeding bulls to be seen roaming the fields, the farer relies on insemination delivered from the Cattle Breeding Centre which is centred within a couple of miles away happens to be the largest in the British Isles
